Base.desc: The Base Group holds anything common to all other Jx classes and widgets.  All JxLib components require this group, so selecting anything else will select this group too.

common.desc: Jx namespace with methods and classes common to most Jx widgets

styles.desc: A singleton object useful for dynamically creating and manipulating CSS styles

object.desc: Base class for all other object in the JxLib framework.

widget.desc: Base class for all widgets (visual classes) in the JxLib Framework.

list.desc: A class that is used to manage lists of DOM elements

Data.desc: This group contains components needed to utilize the data store and it's subclasses.

store.desc: An implementation of a basic data store.

remote.desc: A store with the ability to retrieve and save data to a remote server.

compare.desc: Class that provides functions for comparing various data types. Used by the Jx.Sort class and it's descendants

sort.desc: Base class for the sort algorithm implementations

mergesort.desc: An implementation of the merge sort algorithm

heapsort.desc: An implementation of the heap sort algorithm

quicksort.desc: An implementation of the quick sort algorithm

nativesort.desc: An implementation of the Javascript native sorting with the Jx.Sort interface

Button.desc: This group contains components that are button-like.  All button classes ultimately derive from the basic button class.

button.desc: Jx.Button creates a clickable element that can be added to a web page.

flyout.desc: Flyout buttons expose a panel when the user clicks the button.

tab.desc: A single tab in a tab set.

color.desc: A Jx.ColorPalette wrapped up in a Jx.Button.

multi.desc: Multi buttons are used to contain multiple buttons in a drop down list where only one button is actually visible and clickable in the interface.

combo.desc: A drop down list of selectable items.

set.desc: A ButtonSet manages a set of Jx.Button instances by ensuring that only one of the buttons is active.

Panel.desc: This group contains components that act as a visual container for content.

panel.desc: A panel is a fundamental container object that has a content area and optional toolbars around the content area.

dialog.desc: A Jx.Dialog that implements a floating dialog.

panelset.desc: A panel set manages a set of panels within a DOM element.

message.desc: A subclass of jx.Dialog for displaying messages w/a single OK button.

confirm.desc: A subclass of Jx.dialog for asking a yes/no type question of the user.

Grid.desc: This group contains components related to the Grid control.

grid.desc: A tabular control that has fixed scrolling headers on the rows and columns like a spreadsheet.

columns.desc: A container for defining and holding individual columns

column.desc: A representation of a single grid column

row.desc: Holds information related to display of rows in the grid.

Plugins.desc: This group contains all of the plugins used throughout the framework. You can identify what plugins go with what widgets by the name. For example 'grid.selector' will work with the Jx.Grid class.

grid.selector.desc: Allows selecting rows, columns, and cells in grids

grid.prelighter.desc: Highlights rows, columns, cells, and headers in grids

dataview.groupfolder.desc: Enables closing and opening groups in a group dataview

Menu.desc: This group contains components that are used in the menuing system.  Typically you would want to include all components in this group if you want to include menu support in your application.

context.desc: A Jx.Menu that has no button but can be opened at a specific browser location to implement context menus (for instance).

menu.item.desc: A menu item is a single entry in a menu.

menu.desc: A main menu as opposed to a sub menu that lives inside the menu.

menu.separator.desc: Convenience class to create a visual separator in a menu.

submenu.desc: A sub menu contains menu items within a main menu or another sub menu.

Layout.desc: This group contains components that manage the layout of other components or HTML elements.

layout.desc: Jx.Layout is used to provide more flexible layout options for applications

splitter.desc: A Jx.Splitter creates two or more containers within a parent container and provides user control over the size of the containers.

snap.desc: A helper class to create an element that can snap a split panel open or closed.

Tab.desc: This group contains components used to create tabbed interfaces.  Note that tabs themselves are actually included in the Button group.

tabbox.desc: A convenience class to handle the common case of a single toolbar directly attached to the content area of the tabs.

tabset.desc: A TabSet manages a set of Jx.Button.Tab content areas by ensuring that only one of the content areas is visible (i.e. the active tab).

Toolbar.desc: This group contains components that are used to create toolbars.  Toolbars are typically used to contain buttons but they can also contain other HTML elements and Jx components.  If you are using toolbars in your application, you probably want to include this whole group.

toolbar.desc: A toolbar is a container object that contains other objects such as buttons.

container.desc: A toolbar container contains toolbars.  This has an optional dependency on Fx.Tween that, if included, will allow toolbars that contain more elements than can be displayed to be smoothly scrolled left and right.  Without this optional dependency, the toolbar will jump in fixed increments rather than smoothly scrolling.

toolbar.item.desc: A helper class to provide a container for something to go into a Jx.Toolbar.

toolbar.separator.desc: A helper class that represents a visual separator in a Jx.Toolbar.

Tree.desc: This group contains components required to build a tree.  If you want to include a tree in your application, you will need all the components in this group.

tree.desc: Jx.Tree displays hierarchical data in a tree structure of folders and nodes.

treefolder.desc: A Jx.TreeFolder is an item in a tree that can contain other items. It is expandable and collapsible.

colorpalette.desc: A Jx.ColorPalette presents a user interface for selecting colors.  This is typically combined with a Jx.Button.Color which embeds the color palette in a flyout.

tooltip.desc: These are very simple tooltips that are designed to be instantiated in javascript and directly attached to the object that they are the tip for.

slider.desc: A wrapper for mootools' slider class o=to make it more Jx Friendly.

slide.desc: A class that shows and hides elements using a slide effect. Does not use a wrapper element or require a fixed width or height.

Formatter.desc: This group contains classes used for formatting display output.

currency.desc: Formats input as currency. Currently only US currency is supported

number.desc: Formats numbers including negative and floats

date.desc: Formats dates using the mootools-more Date extensions

phone.desc: Formats phone numbers in US format including area code

Form.desc: This group contains classes used for creating and manipulating forms and other inputs in script.

fieldset.desc: Used to create fieldsets in Forms

select.desc: Represents a select, or drop down, input

file.desc: Represents a file input w/upload and prgress tracking capabilities (requires APC for progress)
